page.title: 19HISTORICAL BUILDINGS
page.content: Brief Historical details of the area:- Warmington Church, dedicated to Saint Mary, dates back to the 12th. century and has some fine dog tooth carving, an excellent example of a rood screen and the finest examples of a broached spire for many miles. The Manor House dates from the 17th. Century. The School was built in 1873, and the Methodist Chapel and the new vicarage in the 1880's. In Fotheringhay the church is part of a much larger former building. Here also is a remnant of the Castle famed for its connection with the unfortunate Mary Queen of Scots. There are the remains of a windmill at Tansor.
